[Portrait]Orlandeau
[Dialog]I, plotting against the duke?
Are you mad?{END}

[Portrait]Southern Sky Knight
[Dialog]Please, my lord. Do not make this harder
than it must be. We have our orders.{END}

Why in the name of all that's good
would I wish to unseat my liege lord?{END}

[Portrait]Duke Goltanna
[Dialog]You ask the very question that vexes me.
I am gravely disappointed in you, Cid.{END}

Surely you cannot mean that,
Your Grace! I am no turncloak!
I am your most loyal man!{END}

The proof speaks otherwise.


It seems you have been in league with
members of the Church, working secretly
to see me ousted from my rightful seat.{END}

That is absurd! From what lying
blackguard did you hear such reverie!?{END}

Even yet you deny it?


My information comes from the High
Confessor himself. You can imagine
his distress upon learning of the plot.{END}

Your Grace, the High Confessor
deceives you! It is he who schemes
in the shadows!{END}

The High Confessor? Now there is an
august claim! Have you any evidence
of this?{END}

Twenty and more years of loyal service,
and still you require evidence? Words
fail me, Your Grace.{END}

As you fail me. I cannot hope to fight a
war without your Order's forces. Still,
it seems I am left no choice.
A lamentable situation for us both.


Take him from my sight!{END}

[Portrait]Delita
[Dialog]You summoned, Your Grace?{END}

I want you to maintain your contact
with Mullonde.

Once the Confessional rescript is in
my hands, Larg is as good as defeated.{END}

Fear not, Your Grace. The High
Confessor's mind is most firm on
that account.{END}

Hmm. He had seemed somewhat
indifferent to me.

There is another matter as well.


I am placing the Order of the Southern
Sky under your leadership. Henceforth,
you are a Knight Devout.{END}

You grant me honor far beyond
my due.{END}

I expect I shall not regret it. I place
my full and utter confidence in you,
Delita-you, and you alone.{END}

Your Grace.{END}
